faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about company formation in Hong Kong

questions.question: How long does Hong Kong company incorporation take?
questions.answer: Standard incorporation takes 5 business days after document submission. This includes 1-2 days for Companies Registry processing and 2-3 days for certificate issuance. Expedited options are available for faster service.

questions.question: Do I need to travel to Hong Kong to register a company?
questions.answer: No physical presence is required. The entire process is handled online through Hong Kong's e-Registry system. We manage document notarization and government submissions remotely for international clients.

questions.question: What is the minimum capital requirement?
questions.answer: Hong Kong has no minimum capital requirement - you can incorporate with just HKD 1. Most businesses start with HKD 10,000 as it's practical for banking and operations.

questions.question: Can foreigners own 100% of a Hong Kong company?
questions.answer: Yes, Hong Kong allows 100% foreign ownership with no restrictions. Both individuals and corporate entities from any country can be sole shareholders with equal rights.

questions.question: What are the ongoing compliance requirements?
questions.answer: Key requirements include: annual return filing within 42 days of incorporation date, profits tax return submission, proper accounting records maintenance, and annual business registration renewal.

questions.question: How much does incorporation cost?
questions.answer: Our complete package starts from ‚Ç¨4,600 including government fees, company documents, official seal, 1-year registered address, and secretary service. Additional services available for complex structures.

questions.question: Do I need a local office address?
questions.answer: Yes, a physical Hong Kong address (not PO Box) is legally required. We provide professional virtual office solutions in central locations that satisfy this requirement affordably.

questions.question: Can I open a corporate bank account remotely?
questions.answer: Yes, through our partnered banks and fintech platforms that accept remote applications. Process includes video verification and typically takes 2-4 weeks for approval.

questions.question: What taxes will my company pay?
questions.answer: Only Hong Kong-sourced profits are taxed at 16.5%. No VAT, capital gains or dividend taxes. Offshore income may qualify for full exemption if properly structured.

questions.question: Is this service legal for non-residents?
questions.answer: Completely legal. Hong Kong encourages international business and grants equal rights to foreign-owned companies. Our services ensure full compliance with all local regulations for non-residents.
